intro: Stachys albotomentosa, commonly known as the white-tomentose hedge nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and clusters of small, pale pink to white flowers. The plant belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and typically grows in moist, shady environments. Its leaves are often covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Stachys albotomentosa is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in damp, nutrient-rich soil.
